page.title: 17Leisure,Whitsbury + Breamore
page.content: Situated in a rural area,Whitsbury and Breamore are isolated as far as recreational activities are concerned and the leisure provision is not likely to get much better.Whitsbury, the smaller of the two villages,can boast a public house with restaurant and games room,and a village hall where private parties are held,as well as a weekly table-tennis club and infrequent discos.There is no parish recreational ground,football or cricket pitch and no organized scouting or guiding groups. In contrast,Breamore has a cricket and football pitch,and a village hall where whist drives,table tennis matches,and the occasional dance take place.At Breamore House,which is open to the public,there is an annual{steam {rally}and antiques fair,a countryside museum,and children's play area which
